result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geronimo R Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Final Pretrial held.  Defense filed motion to adjourn trial as there are numerous interviews with spanish speaking individuals that need to be conducted.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns matter for status to allow ADA Karshen to be present when picking new trial date.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Geronimo R Hernandez in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Geronimo R Hernandez.  Attorney Chad Wozniak for Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motions in Limine received and filed.  bm
Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion To Compel Disclosure of Records, filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (14 pages) commencing 05-11-2022, by Kathleen S. Worden.

Defendant Geronimo R Hernandez in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

*Spanish Interpreter sworn: Reme Bashi.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  State turned over Discovery and made Offer.  Defense requested Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Any Motions to be filed by September 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Geronimo R Hernandez in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E.Kremserova. Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court remind defendant of active No Contact Order and continue with working with Justice Point as to bail conditions. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer.  Received and Filed.  nk

Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

22RM024180  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff
05/04/2022 sa

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.  Court advised Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMC; OH-M; NLR; ATH

Defendant Geronimo R Hernandez in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Geronimo R Hernandez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Geronimo R Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  State request to be heard on bail at Preliminary Hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
